content.text:
# 2012 Green Party presidential primaries

style="font-size:110%; margin:0 auto;"
| title = Green nominee
| before_election = Cynthia McKinney
| after_election = Jill Stein
}}
The Green Party of the United States held primaries in several states in 2012. Jill Stein won most of the primaries and was formally nominated as the party's nominee during the 2012 Green National Convention.
Candidates
{| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center;"
|-
! colspan=2 style="padding:10px; width:120px; " | Candidate
! style="width:300px;"  class="unsortable" | Most recent position
! class="unsortable" | Campaign
! style="padding:10px;" | Delegates
! style="width:275px;" | Delegations with plurality
|-
| data-sort-value="Stein, Jill"|Jill Stein|| style="background:green;"| ||Lexington Town Meeting member(2005–2011)
|  (Campaign • [http://Jillstein.org/ Website])
| data-sort-value="120" |(67.13%)
| data-sort-value="17" | 24AR, AZ, CA,  CO, CT, DE, FL, IL, MA, MI, MS, ME, MN, NJ, NY, OH, PA, RI, SC, TN, VA, WA, DC, WI
|-
| data-sort-value="Barr, Roseanne"|Roseanne Barr|| style="background:#E0E000;" |  ||Comedian, Host of The Roseanne Show
| ([https://www.facebook.com/RoseanneForPresident/ Website])
| data-sort-value="011" |(23.18%)
| data-sort-value="01" |2GA, OR
|-
| data-sort-value="Mesplay, Kent"|Kent Mesplay|| style="background: #500080;"|  ||Inspector at the Air Pollution ControlDistrict of San Diego County(2001–2015)
| ([http://www.mesplay.org/ Website] )
| data-sort-value="004" |(5.36%)
| data-sort-value="00" | None
|-

| ([http://www.harleymikkelson.com Website])
| data-sort-value="005" |(3.48%)
| data-sort-value="00" | None
|-
|colspan=6 style="text-align:center;" |Alternate ballot options
|-
| data-sort-value="No preference/ Other/ Uncommitted"|No preference/ Other/ Uncommitted|| style="background:dimGrey;"| ||colspan=2|N/A
| data-sort-value="008" |(9.69%)
| data-sort-value="00" | None
|}

Oregon convention (June 2)
The Pacific Green Party convention took place on June 2. The members voted using a ranked choice system, but only two candidates received votes so it stayed in one round.
